6.Dialogue: Ok so, in the Dialogue section of a Dialogue Node, you can insert special keywords between [ ] to have certain effects.
6.Speaker: Fred

7.Dialogue:
For example:
putting the letter u between [ ] gives [u]text an underline[/u].
End the effect with [/*], where * is the name of the effect (here, u).
7.Speaker: Fred

8.Dialogue:
Some more examples:
[ [fade length=5] fade [/fade] ]

[ [color=red] color=red [/color] ]

[ [shake rate=20 level=6] shake rate=15 level=6 [/shake] ]

[ [wave] wave [/wave] ]

[ [tornado] tornado [/tornado]]

[ [rainbow] rainbow [/rainbow] ]
8.Speaker: Fred

9.Dialogue:
You can even combine effects like:
[E1] [E2] Text [/E2] [E1]
Where E1 and E2 could be anything.

[rainbow] [wave] Example: Rainbow + Wave [/wave] [/rainbow]
9.Speaker: Fred

10.Text: This example shows how to use bbcodes in your dialogues, as well as an example of a looping dialogue tree.
